At the time of writing, more than 17 million people have contracted COVID-19 globally and more than half a million have died.
1 However, the health impact of COVID-19 is likely to be far more substantial and long-lasting in countries with high incidences of tuberculosis and HIV
2 than in those with low incidences. Tuberculosis and HIV each have more than double the mortality rate of COVID-19, as shown in the Western Cape, South Africa.
